# MONEI Documentation (llms.txt)

## Project summary
- Documentation site for MONEI built with Docusaurus 3.
- Covers product guides, integration examples, and API references (REST + GraphQL).
- Public site: https://docs.monei.com

## Key URLs and endpoints
- MONEI Dashboard: https://dashboard.monei.com
- Support: https://support.monei.com
- REST API base URL: https://api.monei.com/v1
- OpenAPI download: https://js.monei.com/api/v1/openapi.json
- GraphQL endpoint (introspection): https://graphql.monei.com/
- SDKs: https://github.com/MONEI/monei-php-sdk | https://github.com/MONEI/monei-python-sdk | https://github.com/MONEI/monei-node-sdk
- Postman collection: https://postman.monei.com/

## Tech stack
- Docusaurus 3 (preset-classic), React 19, MDX
- API docs: docusaurus-plugin-openapi-docs, docusaurus-theme-openapi-docs
- GraphQL docs: @graphql-markdown/docusaurus
- Search: Algolia (index: monei)
- Tooling: Prettier, Husky, lint-staged

## Repository structure
- `docs/`: MDX content for guides and API references
- `docs/apis/rest`: generated from `openapi.json`
- `docs/apis/graphql`: generated from `schema.graphql`
- `openapi.json`: REST API specification (downloaded in production builds)
- `schema.graphql`: GraphQL schema (downloaded via Rover in production builds)
- `plugins/`: custom Docusaurus plugins
- `src/`: custom React components, pages, and CSS
- `static/`: static assets and examples (HTML, images)
- `scripts/`: generation helpers for REST/GraphQL docs
- `utils/`: utility scripts (e.g., search reindexing)

## Local development
Prerequisites:
- Node.js >= 22
- Yarn >= 4.7.0 (packageManager: yarn@4.12.0)

Commands:
- `yarn`: install dependencies
- `yarn start`: run local dev server
- `yarn build`: build static site
- `yarn serve`: serve build output
- `yarn deploy`: deploy using Docusaurus config
- `yarn genapi:rest`: regenerate REST API docs from `openapi.json`
- `yarn genapi:graphql`: regenerate GraphQL docs from `schema.graphql`
- `yarn reindex`: rebuild search index

## Formatting and quality
- Prettier runs on staged files via lint-staged and Husky.

- MIT
